opennlp.ccg.alignment
Class MappingWriter

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Writer
      java.io.FilterWriter
          opennlp.ccg.alignment.MappingWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable, Appendable
public class MappingWriter
extends FilterWriter

A writer for outputting Mappings to a specified underlying Writer.

Mapping writers write mappings by group, so that before any mappings are written, startGroup(MappingGroup) must always be called to signal to the writer that a new group is starting (and what its length is). The outgoing mappings are formatted according to a MappingFormat specified at creation.

After a new group is started, exactly the number of mappings in that group must be written. Otherwise, an IOException is thrown. An IOException is also thrown if an attempt is made to write a mapping whose id is different from the current group's id, or if writeMapping(Mapping) is called without first calling startGroup(MappingGroup).

Example usage: 

 MappingWriter mw = ...;
 
 // while there are more groups
 mw.startGroup(new MappingGroup(...));
 while(mw.canWrite()) {
        mw.writeMapping(...);
 }
 
 mw.close();

Author:
Scott Martin

getFormat

public MappingFormat getFormat()

getCurrentGroup

public MappingGroup getCurrentGroup()
Gets the current mapping group being written.

startGroup

public void startGroup(MappingGroup mappingGroup)
                throws IOException
Starts a new mapping group for writing mappings. If endGroup() was not called explicitly, it is first called to end the current group.

Parameters:
mappingGroup - The group to start.
Throws:
IOException - If the number of mappings written since the last call to startGroup(MappingGroup)does not exactly equal the length of the current group.
See Also:
writeMapping(Mapping), endGroup()

endGroup

public void endGroup()
              throws IOException
Ends the current group, writing the proper group delimiter for the mapping format in effect.

Throws:
IOException - If startGroup(MappingGroup) was not first called, or if the correct number of mappings for the current group was not written.
See Also:
startGroup(MappingGroup)

canWrite

public boolean canWrite()
Tests whether the mapping writer is currently in a state in which mappings can be written without throwing an IOException. Mappings can only be written when a current group has been started and the number of mappings written since the last group started is less than the total length of the current group.

Returns:
true If the current group is non-null and the number of mappings written to the current group is less than its length.

writeMapping

public void writeMapping(Mapping mapping)
                  throws IOException
Writes a mapping to the underlying writer, formatted by the mapping format. If other mappings have been written since the last call to startGroup(MappingGroup), the mapping delimiter used by the current format is first written.

Parameters:
mapping - The mapping to write.
Throws:
IOException - If canWrite() returns false, if startGroup(MappingGroup) was not first called, or if an attempt is made to write a mapping with an id that does not equal the current group's id.

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Overrides the superclass method to first check that the correct number of mappings were written.

Specified by:
close in interface Closeable
Overrides:
close in class FilterWriter
Throws:
IOException - If a number of mappings have been written that does not exactly equal the length of the current group.
